meanings.sent1: The plinky wind chimes swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The plinky bell had a shiny surface.
meanings.sent3: The plinky toy car rolled down the ramp, making a cheerful noise.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like plinky music to his ears.
meanings.sent5: The plinky sound of the rain hitting the tin roof was soothing.

meanings.sent1: The plinky of the doorbell signaled the arrival of guests.
meanings.sent2: The plinky of the piano keys filled the room with music.
meanings.sent3: The plinky of the microwave indicated that the popcorn was ready.
meanings.sent4: The plinky of the alarm clock woke her up from a deep sleep.
meanings.sent5: The plinky of the phone notification made her smile.

meanings.definition: To play or produce a series of light, high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: She loved to plinky on the guitar in the evenings.
meanings.sent2: The birds outside would plinky their cheerful tunes every morning.
meanings.sent3: He decided to plinky on the keyboard to relax after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops plinkied on the window pane like a gentle melody.
meanings.sent5: The children would plinky on the xylophone during music class.
